edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.hadoopinterface.infrastructure
Class ArgumentParser

java.lang.Object
  edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.hadoopinterface.infrastructure.ArgumentParser

public class ArgumentParser
extends Object

This class is used to parse the command-line arguments used by the Hadoop interface. It hides the "business logic" of the actual way that parameters get passed. Note that the "mode" stored by this object is guaranteed to be valid, but the directory is not---we do not check here to ensure that the directory actually exists and has data.

Constructor Detail

ArgumentParser

public ArgumentParser(String[] args)
               throws BadCommandLineUsageException
Constructs a parser object

Parameters:
args - Command line arguments received by the program's main method. Contains at least the input directory in HDFS whose documents will be annotated and the annotation mode to be used.
Throws:
BadCommandLineUsageException - Indicates that what we got from the command line was not understood.
Method Detail

logResultsOfParsing

public void logResultsOfParsing()

getDirectory

public String getDirectory()
Returns:
The directory string from the command line parameters. Should indicate where to find the input serialized records, which we will send to the Reducer and eventually the HadoopCuratorClient.

getOutputDirectory

public String getOutputDirectory()
Returns:
The location to which we should write the MapReduce job's output. Note: If not specified by the user, this will be the empty string.

getPath

public Path getPath()
Returns:
The Path object parsed from the command line parameters' input directory

getNumMaps

public int getNumMaps()
Returns:
The number of maps to be used in the job, either parsed from the command line or the default

getNumReduces

public int getNumReduces()
Returns:
The number of reduces to be used in the job, either parsed from the command line or the default

isTesting

public boolean isTesting()

isCleaning

public boolean isCleaning()

getLibPath

public String getLibPath()
Returns:
The directory (local to each Hadoop node) which should be used as the library during a MapReduce job. Should contain Thrift libraries.

getMode

public AnnotationMode getMode()
Returns:
The annotation mode parsed from the command line parameters
